p: In the past two decades of the 20 th century, several studies have reported on the beneficial properties of Jatropha lattices. Proanthocyanidin polymers have been found in the latex of J. multifida and showed anti-complement activity [ 6]. The latex of Jatropha curcas has a proteolytic enzyme of around 22 kDa, and the diluted latex showed healing action when applied topically, although the undiluted latex produced caustic lesions [ 7, 8]. In addition, a novel cyclic nonapeptide with L-amino acids was identified in J. podagrica latex with cytotoxicity activity [ 9].
